long_description: Meant for high-speed cross-country trails, the big-wheeled Scott Spark 29er 950 is a sturdy full-suspension mountain bike with 3 suspension modes you can change at the flip of a switch. Hydroformed and butted 6061 aluminum frame is lightweight and sturdy; geometry has been fine-tuned to maximize suspension performance. Fox 32 Float 29 Evolution CTD Air suspension fork has 100mm of air-sprung travel; Fox Float CTD rear shock has a progressive damping curve and excellent sensitivity. TwinLoc system provides remote, bar-top control of suspension travel and lockout, letting you customize performance on the fly. 3 TwinLoc settings supply full travel front and rear, Traction mode (full travel on fork with limited rear suspension), and lockout for both front and rear. Oversize bearings help keep suspension stiff and responsive; rear shock linkage chip lets you adjust head tube angle by 0.5deg to meet your geometry preferences. 3x10 Shimano drivetrain features an XT Shadow Plus rear derailleur along with Deore shifters and front derailleur for responsive shifts across the 30 gear combintations. Shimano BR-M505 hydraulic disc brakes use a 180mm rotor up front and a 160mm rotor in back to facilitate responsive, progressive braking. Sturdy 29er wheels are outfitted with fast-rolling Schwalbe Rocket Ron tires with lightweight Kevlar(R) beads. Specs on the Scott Spark 950 29er full-suspension mountain bike are subject to change.
